{"id":957052008,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"2 weeks, 1 day","timestamp":1685015965,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"27 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/957052008/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Recover Binary Search Tree","memory":"57.7 MB","code":"/**\n * Definition for a binary tree node.\n * struct TreeNode {\n *     int val;\n *     TreeNode *left;\n *     TreeNode *right;\n *     TreeNode() : val(0), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}\n *     TreeNode(int x) : val(x), left(nullptr), right(nullptr) {}\n *     TreeNode(int x, TreeNode *left, TreeNode *right) : val(x), left(left), right(right) {}\n * };\n */\nclass Solution {\npublic:\n    TreeNode* node1; TreeNode* node2; TreeNode* prev;\n    void rt(TreeNode* root) {\n        if (!root) return;\n        rt(root->left);\n        if (prev && prev->val > root->val) {\n            if (!node1) {\n                node1 = prev;\n                node2 = root;\n            } else\n                node2 = root;\n        }\n        prev = root;\n        rt(root->right);\n    }\n    void recoverTree(TreeNode* root) {\n        node1 = NULL;\n        node2 = NULL;\n        prev = NULL;\n        rt(root);\n        swap(node1->val, node2->val);\n    }\n};","compare_result":"","title_slug":"recover-binary-search-tree","has_notes":false}
